bluff.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to pretend something, especially in order to achieve what you want in a difficult or dangerous situation
bluff.translation[0].definitions[0].note: bluff somebody into (doing) something (=make someone do something by deceiving them)
bluff.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: You wouldn’t really tell her. You’re bluffing!
‘I was with Don, ’ she said, deciding to bluff it out  (=continue to pretend something).
I hope we’ll be able to bluff our way past the guard.
bluff your way out of/through/past etc somebody/something
bluff.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: an attempt to deceive someone by making them think you will do something, when you do not intend to do it
bluff.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The threat was only a bluff.
Whatever you say, you must do it. This isn’t a game of bluff.
bluff.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a very steep cliff or slope
bluff.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a bluff person, usually a man, is pleasant but very direct and does not always consider other people
bluff.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: He was a bluff no-nonsense administrator.
